title: Marine Le Pen's 2027 presidential rivals adjust their strategies to her legal timetable
subhead: With the far-right leader due to hear her fate from the Court of Appeal on July 7, her prospective rivals in the 2027 presidential election are already preparing for the possibility that she may step aside for Jordan Bardella, and are strategizing how to exploit his weaknesses.

title: Italian PM Meloni visits Ethiopia and confirms her ambitions in Africa
Macron defends European model at Munich Security Conference
Ex-president Hollande's 2027 presidential election comeback is fraught with obstacles
subhead: Once dismissed as far-fetched just a few months ago, former Socialist president François Hollande's candidacy is now seen as a credible scenario. However, he must face several obstacles within both the broader left and his Socialist party.

title: Storm Nils kills three in France and Spain
subhead: Around 450,000 households were without electricity on Friday after the storm tore through southern France. Portugal was also hit.

title: How the Ivorian president's niece acted as Epstein's go-between
subhead: The Epstein files reveal the close relationship between the late financier and Nina Keita, who introduced him to young women and local business leaders. The niece of Côte d'Ivoire's president, Alassane Ouattara, now holds a senior position in Abidjan.

title: Mika opens the doors to his Tuscany villa: 'Throw us anywhere, and we'll make poetry'
subhead: The singer will chair the 41st edition of the Victoires de la Musique, France's annual music awards ceremony, on Friday, following the late January release of his seventh album, 'Hyperlove.' Currently on tour, he will perform in Paris on Monday.

title: Bangladesh ends its authoritarian chapter as BNP wins parliamentary majority

NATO shake-up fails to boost France's influence within the alliance
UK high court upholds activist group Palestine Action's challenge against government ban
ECB fines French bank Crédit Agricole for failing to identify climate risks
Trump revokes key climate finding, dismantling legal basis for emissions rules
German Chancellor Merz urges US to repair ties with Europe
French people exposed to 'concerning' levels of cadmium, lead and aluminum through food
US immigration agency contracts thrive on Trump's anti-migrant policies
Macron denounces 'antisemitic hydra' and calls for election bans for antisemitic and racist acts
Iran releases two senior reformists arrested after nation-wide protests
For Laurence Fournier Beaudry and Guillaume Cizeron, Olympic gold at Milan 2026 is a 'goal achieved' after much 'uncertainty'
France's demographics debate focuses on birth rates while ignoring touchier measures
subhead: Politicians have struggled to address the various aspects of France's current demographic shift. The debate on the issue remains focused on boosting birth rates, while steering clear of more sensitive topics such as immigration or the retirement age.

title: Why are major powers competing for control of the Arctic?
subhead: The Arctic has become a strategic focal point for countries, lying at the intersection of climate and geopolitical challenges. Climate change has sharply accelerated this transformation.

title: 'The decline in birth rates is a social phenomenon, not a woman's responsibility'
subhead: Instead of questioning the collective factors behind declining birth rates, the dominant narrative shifts responsibility onto women, laments Brigitte Grésy, former president of France's High Council for Gender Equality, and Micheline Misrahi-Abadou, professor at the faculty of medicine of Paris-Saclay University.

title: A balanced choice on energy despite populist pressures
'The Washington Post became the collateral damage of Jeff Bezos's choice to forge the strongest possible ties with Trump'
Jimmy Lai, a symbol of the end of freedom in Hong Kong
